name: Nico Chen
core_wound: Abandoned by his family at age 19 when his addiction made him 'too much trouble' - believes he's fundamentally unworthy of love or belonging
wants: To be seen as valuable, to escape the lower tiers, to matter to someone
needs: To accept that the system is broken and his worth isn't defined by tier level, to build genuine community rather than buy loyalty
voice_markers: Self-deprecating humor even in dark situations
Uses street slang mixed with occasional formal words (remnant of his pre-addiction education)
Deflects emotional moments with jokes or profanity
Says 'yeah?' as a verbal tic when uncertain
contradiction: Wants to help people but struggles to trust anyone completely; craves connection but keeps everyone at arm's length
physical_description: East Asian descent, thin from years of poor nutrition and drug use, nervous energy, scarred hands from years of street fights and manual labor, by his 40s looks a decade older than he is
skills: Street-smart - knows how to survive in lower tiers
Decent with technology (former tech student before dropout)
Reading people - knows when someone's lying
Drug trade knowledge - supply chains, cutting, distribution
flaws: Addiction to Veil throughout entire trilogy
Difficulty accepting help or showing vulnerability
Paranoid due to years of street life
knowledge_state_book1_start: How to survive in Level 8 slums
Doesn't know anything about high finance, legal systems, or upper tier culture

relationships.Maya Torres: Former friend from before addiction, now a social worker who occasionally tries to help him - complex mix of guilt, shame, and buried affection
relationships.Kade Rivera: Supplier and occasional friend, another addict and dealer, only person Nico semi-trusts at start
relationships.Station Security: Antagonistic - he's been arrested multiple times, knows which guards take bribes
relationships.Level 8 community: Known but not liked - he's just another dealer to most, invisible to many
